item-1.title: What is a web performance audit?
item-1.description: A web performance audit is a comprehensive analysis of your website to identify issues affecting its speed, usability, and overall performance.

item-2.title: How long does the audit take?
item-2.description: The complete audit process typically takes between 10 and 15 business days, depending on the size and complexity of your website.

item-3.title: What will I receive at the end of the audit?
item-3.description: You will receive a detailed report with key findings, specific recommendations, and an action plan to improve your website's performance.

item-4.title: How is the audit performed?
item-4.description: We use advanced tools and proven methods to evaluate all aspects of your website, including load speed, image optimization, code, site structure, and more.

item-5.title: How does ongoing support work?
item-5.description: We become part of your team. We will continuously monitor your website and provide specific advice to improve it. Depending on the plan, we will also conduct pair programming and workshops.

item-6.title: Can I cancel my subscription at any time?
item-6.description: Yes, you can cancel your subscription at any time by contacting us.

item-7.title: Which metrics do we focus on?
item-7.description: We focus on improving the Core Web Vitals of your website.

item-8.title: What are Core Web Vitals?
item-8.description: Core Web Vitals are a set of metrics defined by Google that measure the real user experience.

item-9.title: What communication channel do we use?
item-9.description: We create a channel on Discord where we include your entire team so they can request help or resolve doubts whenever they want.

item-10.title: Do you offer performance improvement guarantees?
item-10.description: While we cannot guarantee specific improvements due to the variability in each website's conditions, our track record shows that all our clients experience significant improvements in their Core Web Vitals.

ReviewsPage.title: Web Performance Reviews of Real Sites
ReviewsPage.description:
At PerfReviews, we analyze the performance of websites. It's an ideal way to teach how to use tools to detect, fix, and prevent performance issues.



We are recognized Google Developer Experts in web technologies and have extensive experience developing websites with a special focus on usability, accessibility, and performance.



Since websites are dynamic projects, the reviews may mention aspects that are no longer reproducible. Therefore, we accompany the videos with a series of reports that allow you to visualize a 'snapshot' of the website at the time of the study.

meta.title: Web Performance Tools
meta.description: Tools and platforms I use for web performance audits. From snippets to enterprise monitoring solutions.

ToolsPage.title: Web Performance Tools
ToolsPage.description: Tools and platforms I use daily to analyze, monitor, and optimize web performance for projects of any scale.

snippets.title: WebPerf Snippets
snippets.description: Collection of browser console snippets with ready-to-use scripts to analyze Core Web Vitals, detect unoptimized images, audit critical resources, and debug JavaScript, ideal for quick audits without additional tools.

devtools.title: Chrome DevTools
devtools.description: Essential tool for real-time performance analysis with Performance panel to identify bottlenecks, Lighthouse for complete audits, Coverage to detect unused code, and Network panel to optimize resources.

debugbear.title: DebugBear
debugbear.description: Continuous monitoring platform with synthetic and RUM metrics including Core Web Vitals tracking across multiple pages, performance regression analysis, automatic alerts, and detailed reports with specific recommendations.

speedcurve.title: SpeedCurve
speedcurve.description: Performance monitoring with synthetic metrics, RUM, and competitive analysis that allows you to compare your performance against competitors, track performance budgets, and analyze the impact of production changes.

webperfreport.title: Web Performance Report
webperfreport.description: Detailed web performance report generator based on Lighthouse with automatic analysis of multiple URLs, exportable reports, and recommendations prioritized by impact, perfect for documented audits and client presentations.

secondary.title: Experience with enterprise platforms
secondary.description: I have implemented and worked with various enterprise-level monitoring and observability solutions across projects of different scales and traffic levels. Experience with Datadog (APM and RUM), New Relic (full-stack observability), Sentry (error tracking and performance), Akamai mPulse (RUM at scale), and Treo.sh (Core Web Vitals monitoring).

AboutUsPage.title: About me
AboutUsPage.bio:
I'm Joan León, Web Performance Artisan. I work with teams and companies to create digital experiences that truly deliver: fast, efficient, and driving real business results.



As a Google Developer Expert in Web Technologies and Cloudinary Ambassador, I combine technical expertise with strategic vision. I don't just identify performance issues—I help solve them and, more importantly, prevent them.



My approach is artisanal: every project is unique and deserves personalized attention. From detailed audits to continuous optimization, I ensure your team not only improves metrics but understands the why behind every change.



I share knowledge at conferences, workshops, and on joanleon.dev because I believe a faster web is a better web for everyone. Currently, I'm exploring how AI can automate audits without losing the experience and human touch that make the difference.



Web performance isn't just a technical metric: it's the difference between losing or winning a customer, between frustration or satisfaction. And that's where I can help you.
